text: for decades these men in black have
represented the gold standard of
personal protection but a series of
lapses have put the US Secret Service in
a different light those party crashers
at last week state dinner have left a
very embarrassed Secret Service Secret
Service is trying to track a bullet
fired into the president's home the
widening investigation into the Secret
Service prostitution scandal security
contractor with a gun and a criminal
record wrote in an elevator with the
president a man armed with a knife was
able to jump the fence and make it
inside the front door of the White House
some of the egregious mistakes that I've
read in the paper I cannot remember
within five and a half years on the
president's detail some background on
the chain of mistakes and the importance
of leadership as the Secret Service
tries to get past it's difficult stretch
go back there's no excuse for somebody
with jumping the fence running all the
way in going right past the staircase
that would have gone out to the second
floor residents that's just inexcusable
didn't take me long to figure out that
there's no glamour in this business it
was just plain hard work The Secret
Service is a unique organization because
most of the time there aren't really
problems and nothing really happens it's
hard to quantify whether they're doing a
good job aside from the fact that the
president is still safe no secret
serviceman can tell when his training
and his judgment may save the life of
the President of the United States the
same truth holds today in the aftermath
of the most recent White House security
breach at its core many of the problems
traced back to agency executives it's
clear that our security plan was not
properly executed this is unacceptable
and I take full responsibility you can
have great technology to have great
plans but if you don't use it the way
you plan on using it then it's it's
useless in a White House I know they
have lockdown procedures if there's some
type of intrusion I'm not sure that
happened in this case and it's probably
a glaring failure of the security
planets in place of the White House the
mistakes piled up both under julie
Pearson who took over in 2013 as well as
under her predecessors many felt the
agency was lacking in two crucial areas
first there was the main job of
establishing and executing security
plans but perhaps equally important were
the failings in Washington's political
arena I think the biggest problem that
julia pierson had was that she didn't
communicate well with the White House
and that was really what led to her
ouster at the Secret Service they need
someone who really can go up to Congress
and when they have to testify in public
he's not afraid to point their finger
back at the members of Congress if you
project weakness that invites attacks I
think that was one of the biggest
problems that julia pierson had is when
she went in front of Congress she really
needed to be aggressive and really
explain to Congress what had gone on at
the agency but she didn't show the anger
than I think the members really wanted
to say the protection of the president
has to be precise it has to be flawless
and there has to be accountability when
that is not the case
miss Pearson and her predecessors were
also unable to stop budget cuts the
resulting Secret Service downsizing led
to what people inside the agency say was
staff burnout and low morale I know a
lot of Star Secret Service agents at the
8 10 12 year mark that I supervise who
corporate America would come talk to
they would take that because it was the
financial incentive wasnt there.the
state they just cannot turn down the
money a lot of those positions are
protecting executives whether it's Major
League Baseball or significant financial
institutions that's what the Secret
Service is well known for and how to
protect individuals and assets so it's a
skill set that's needed in the private
sector now the challenge at Secret
Service headquarters will be more than
just writing the ship it's time to
change the culture its messaging you
needs new leadership to say this is
unacceptable from the top down that you
know we need to change the way we're
doing all business the agency may
require a wholesale change in how it
responds to threats towards the
president as the new leadership regains
its political standing on Capitol Hill
and at the White House I think that that
could be one of the positive things
moving forward with some new leadership
coming into the organization restore the
confidence in the public that they can
get back to the level that they we know
that they can do it the question is is
whether they can actually do that are
they an organization that can be
flawless because they have to be slow
